query: how do I set the time on my watch that has a date and a 24 hour hand?
response:
To set the time on your Tudor watch with a date and a 24-hour hand, follow these steps:

* Pull the crown out to the first notch (Source: [Document 2, page 24]).
* Set the reference time using the 24-hour hand against the graduations on the bezel and the minute hand against the graduations on the dial by turning the crown in either direction (Source: [Document 3, page 22]).
* Use the hour hand to set the local time. The hour hand moves in increments of one hour when setting the date (Source: [Document 2, page 24]).

Once you have set the reference time and local time, push in and then screw down the crown (Source: [Document 1, page 26]).

Summary:
To set the time on your Tudor watch with a date and a 24-hour hand, start by pulling out the crown to the first notch. Then, use the crown to set the reference time using the 24-hour hand and minute hand. Finally, adjust the hour hand to set the local time, and push in and screw down the crown when you are finished.

Sources:
[Document 2, page 24]; [Document 3, page 22]; [Document 1, page 26]

query: how do I se the time on my 3 hand time only tudor watch?
response:
To set the time on your 3-hand Tudor watch, follow these steps:

* Push in and then screw down the crown.
* The 24-hour hand should be read against the bezel to indicate the time in the third time zone.

The minutes are shown on the dial by the minute hand (except where the time zone has been negatively offset by a half hour).

Summary: To set the time on your Tudor watch, first push and screw down the crown. Then, use the 24-hour hand to read the time in the third time zone against the bezel, with minutes shown on the dial by the minute hand.

Sources:
[Source: tudor-userguides-en-2.pdf]
[Source: data/domain2/tudor-userguides-en-2.pdf, page 29]
